properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 18 at 4:54AM AKST until February 19 at 5:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12
inches.

* WHEN...Until 5 AM AKST Wednesday. The heaviest snow will be from
late morning through late this afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Periods of very
intense snow could cause near whiteout conditions at times. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening
commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A band of rain and snow will shift east
over the Anchorage area through the morning hours. As gusty
southeast winds die off, temperatures will drop quickly causing
the rain to turn to all snow.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather
conditions will make travel very hazardous. If you must travel,
keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case
of an emergency.

For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit
511.alaska.gov.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM AKST WEDNESDAY
